text: Nitrite is an ion. Its chemical formula is NO2–. It contains nitrogen in its +3 oxidation state. Nitrites are normally strong oxidizing agents. Most of them are colorless crystalline compounds. Sodium nitrite is a common nitrite. They are also weak reducing agents, being oxidized to nitrates (NO3–). ==Related pages== *Nitrate *Nitride *Azide Category:Nitrogen compounds Category:Oxyanions
title: Nitrite
